meanings.sent1: The tiny calix of the flower held rainwater like a little cup.
meanings.sent2: The calix of the lily protected the delicate petals inside.
meanings.sent3: The calix of the plant seemed to be whispering secrets to the petals.
meanings.sent4: The calix of the flower was a protective shield, guarding its inner beauty.
meanings.sent5: The calix, like a tiny bowl, cradled the heart of the bloom.

meanings.definition: The outermost group of floral parts, typically green and leaf-like, that encloses the flower bud.
meanings.sent1: The calix of the rose bud was still tightly closed.
meanings.sent2: The calix of the daisy bud slowly unfurled to reveal the petals inside.
meanings.sent3: The calix of the bud looked like a little green umbrella protecting the flower.
meanings.sent4: The calix of the bud held the promise of the bloom within.
meanings.sent5: The calix, like a green cloak, shielded the flower bud from harm.

meanings.definition: A cup or goblet used in religious ceremonies, especially in Roman Catholic Mass.
meanings.sent1: The priest held the golden calix during the Mass.
meanings.sent2: The calix on the altar was intricately decorated with symbols.
meanings.sent3: The calix gleamed in the candlelight, adding a touch of magic to the ceremony.
meanings.sent4: The calix, like a sacred vessel, held the wine for communion.
meanings.sent5: The calix, a symbol of reverence, was carefully handled during the service.
